intro: Psychotria celastroides, commonly known as the "Cocaine plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which are found primarily in its leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is both ecologically significant and subject to strict legal regulations.
